newsitem.title: UK: Mauritius 1996 sugar output rises year/year.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius 1996 sugar output rises year/year.

text.p: Mauritius produced 588,455 tonnes of sugar tel quel in 1996, up from the 539,521 tonnes turned out in the previous year, the Mauritius Sugar Syndicate said in a statement on Tuesday.
But overall 1996 exports of 612,524 tonnes exceeded production after the country imported 31,010 tonnes of sugar and also drew on stocks, the data showed.

Monthly production and imports were sharply lower on a year-on-year basis, with just 1,133 tonnes produced in December after a previous 13,494 tonnes, and 3,998 tonnes imported after 19,939 tonnes in December 1995.
The December imports were from South Africa.
As usual, the European Union bought most of the sugar, with the United Kingdom taking the lion's share of 478,339 tonnes.
This was followed by Portugal, which bought 45,200 tonnes under Special Preferential Sugar (SPS) terms.
Mauritius exported 523,889 tonnes of sugar in 1995.
Closing sugar stocks stood at 143,128 tonnes in December 1996 compared with 175,509 tonnes in December 1995, the statement said.
Annual consumption remained broadly unchanged at 38,070 tonnes after a previous 37,201 tonnes.
